item.description: On the water at 8:30 this morning to catch the tide

This guy woke us at 5am this morning. Who knew that peacocks sat in trees?

After a busy Saturday, it was great to get out of the house and do one of our favourite walks from Bulberry Head to Hope Cove, Devon.

#devon

Our last beach walk of the year was at Bigbury-on-Sea. It stayed dry despite the promise of rain in the clouds.

iPhone 14 Pro, processed in #Photomator 📷 #devon
The old kitchen has gone, and the new one is ready to be installed. Parker is wondering what’s happening to his bedroom.

Lightroom’s Generative Fill is impressive. This is a before and after photo of the tower on Glastonbury Tor.

Sony a6300, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

It was overcast on our dog walk yesterday, so black and white seemed appropriate.

I spent my afternoon shovelling sh*t at the allotment. I hope next year’s veggies appreciate the effort.
Peter Pumpkinhead has arrived early this year.

Sunday started at the pumpkin patch and finished on the beach.

The high tide curtailed our walk this morning

Beach day in September

Photos from my Friday morning walk from home to Bantham. This was the first sunny day after a week of mainly rain.

iPhone 14 Pro, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Day 1: abstract #mbsept

iPhone 14 Pro, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
Happiness is an overflowing wood store at the end of August.

Today’s dog walk was a 5-mile circular route from East Prawle, which is the southern most village in Devon. We enjoyed sea views for most of the walk, made even better when the sun finally broke through the clouds.

iPhone 14 Pro, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
We were joined by this family on our walk along the estuary this evening 📷

View of Ayrmer Cove, South Devon, taken from the South West Coast Path.

iPhone 14 Pro, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

I was out with the dog before 6 AM today and was rewarded with lovely early-morning views over the Devon countryside. These are the first photos taken with my new iPhone 14 Pro.

iPhone 14 Pro, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
Evening walk to Hope Cove 📷

I took this photo of St. Andrew’s Church in Aveton Gifford, Devon, on this morning’s walk with the dog. What a great way to start the day!

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
View of Salcombe from Start Tor 📷
Apparently, it’s National Gin Day, so I’d be rude not to join in
Not a bad place to walk the dog after work 📷

View of Thurlestone Rock, taken from South Milton Beach, Devon, yesterday evening whilst walking the dog.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
Early morning at the allotment 🌱
Morning dog walk along the estuary at low tide 📷

Aveton Gifford Coronation Street Party

Like many other communities, we arranged a street party to celebrate the coronation. Whatever your opinions about the monarchy, the event brought people together, and everyone had a good time.

Here are some photos.

Misty morning dog walk.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

We need to check the tide times when walking the dog, as it’s easy to get caught on the wrong side of the causeway if we get it wrong.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

The walk down into Hope Cove, Devon.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

This was the highest tide we’ve experienced since we moved to Aveton Gifford in South Devon.

The stream is usually a few inches deep, but it was over the bridge handrails this morning.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
The sun has finally come out in Kingsbridge
We’ve got a dog that thinks he’s a cat 🐕

item.title: Country and Coast - Two Dog Walks in One Day
item.description:
We moved to South Devon a month ago, renting a renovated barn while looking for our new permanent home. We live a few miles from the coast, in the middle of farming country, which means that in the morning, we explore the local woods and footpaths.

Here’s a photo of Topsham Bridge, taken around 8am yesterday.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic

Since moving, it’s compulsory to go to the coast at the weekend, and yesterday we went to the beach at Thurlestone just before sunset.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Dodging the rain at Bantham Beach, Devon

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom iPad app 📷

item.title: Microblogvember 2022: Day 2
item.description:
I don’t think I’ll be making a feast with these beauties that are growing out of our doorstep.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

I think it may rain today …

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Sunday morning coffee and pastry at Bigbury-on-Sea, Devon.

Canon EOS M6 Mark II, EF-M 15-45mm, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2023 📷

It’s our first weekend living in Devon so we had to go to the beach.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022 📷

First time in Kingsbridge, Devon as a resident and not a tourist.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022 📷
A day in the life. All packed by 7:48pm on our last day living in Draycot Cerne, Wiltshire, UK after ten happy years. This time tomorrow we’ll be living in Devon. 📷

This dahlia is always the star of our front garden #FridayPhoto 📷🌱

Canon EOS M6 Mark II, EF-M 15-45mm, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022

Industrial furnaces #FridayPhoto 📷

iPhone 11, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022
Just finished my shift behind the bar at the village beer and sausage festival. Time for a beer 🍺

Mist over the fields in the early morning 📷

iPhone 11, Halide II app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022
Closed my Adobe Creative Cloud account and moved to ON1 Photo Raw 2022.

Lines in the sky #FridayPhoto 📷

iPhone 11, Halide II app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022

Dead wood #FridayPhoto 📷

iPhone 11, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022

This is the first photo from my new (previously enjoyed) Canon EOS M6 Mark II and the kit EF-M 15-45mm lens.

I’m pleased to be back with Canon after a couple of years of shooting with a Sony a6300 as I much prefer the way the Canon handles. 📷🌱

Canon EOS M6 II, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022

My neighbour has been moving the earth to extend his wildlife pond #FridayPhoto 📷

iPhone 11, Halide app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022
Did an hour of Park Yoga this morning before it got too hot 🧘🏼‍♂️

Some kind soul has put a bucket of water outside their garden for the dogs to drink in this hot weather #FridayPhoto 📷

iPhone 11, Halide app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022

Learning how to use the Halide app whilst out with the dog this morning.

iPhone 11, Halide app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2022 📷
Early walk with “the boy” before it becomes too hot 📷

A small waterfall I spotted while out walking the dog.

Dramatic sky when out walking the dog this morning.

First frost of the season 📷

The new feeding station for the birds is open for business 🌱
I’m enjoying using the Argentum Camera app on my iPhone. Here are a couple of images from today’s early morning walk with “the boy” over the fields. 📷

item.title: Lest We Forget
item.description:
For heathen heart that puts her trust
In reeking tube and iron shard,
All valiant dust that builds on dust,
And guarding, calls not Thee to guard,
For frantic boast and foolish word—
Thy mercy on Thy People, Lord!

Source: A Choice of Kipling’s Verse (1943)

Sony a6300, Sony E 16-70 F4 ZA OSS, processed in Luminar AI 📷

item.title: Testing out Street mode in Argentum app
item.description:
I got a haircut this morning, and this is a candid shot of Isaac prepping the chair I took on my iPhone 11 using the Argentum app. The image is as shot with no post-processing.

Thanks to @TheDimPause on Micro.blog for pointing me in the direction of the Argentum app, which captures Black & White images. 📷

item.description:
Twin-cylinder Morgan

Car bonnet (hood) mascot

I’ve got three invites to Glass if anyone wants one 📷
Happiness is a full wood store, even if it is the hottest weekend of the year. 📷

Here’s “Wally” the walrus famous around the Isles of Scilly. I spotted him chilling out on the back of the Scilly water ambulance today.

Sony a6300, Sony E 16-70 F4 ZA OSS 📷

Hugh Town harbour, St. Mary’s, Isles of Scilly

Sony a6300, Sony E 16-70 F4 ZA OSS 📷

item.title: Cycle tour of St. Mary’s, Isles of Scilly.
item.description:
Cycle tour of St. Mary’s, Isles of Scilly. It’s the best way to see the island and suits the slower pace of life here.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic

🚲📷

View of Hugh Town harbour on St. Mary’s, Isles of Scilly, taken from our hotel room this morning.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

I liked the detail on this gnarly old tree we saw on our walk yesterday.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Gentle ride to Malmesbury for coffee and cake with Janet.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷🚲

View of St. Giles Church, Tytherton Kellaways, Wiltshire from across the meadow.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

It was a misty morning walk today.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
First indoor coffee for over 6 months. It’s good to be back ☕️

Full wet weather gear needed for this morning's tramp around the fields with Parker.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

This weekend's project — turn a rusty fire pit into a water feature. Looking forward to seeing how it develops over the coming months.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 🌱

Setting off to walk the dog before breakfast. It's likely the best weather we'll see today.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Sad to see that our neighbour cut down a 400-year old oak tree and reduced it to a load of lumber.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷🌱

Having breakfast on the patio, listening to the birds singing for the first time this year.

📷

The meadow is full of these wild flowers. Struggling to get a sharp photo on the iPhone.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷🌱

We held our first in-person board meeting on Wednesday at a colleagues house. He lives 20 minutes from the Cornish coast, so I took my wife and the dog, and we went to Black Rock beach afterwards. The word “bracing” springs to mind.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

The weather is horrible here today — heavy rain on a Bank Holiday, so here's a photo of some apple blossom I took yesterday.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in ON1 Photo RAW 2021 📷🌱

Draycot Cerne Chapel of Rest through the apple blossom, taken this morning whilst out with the dog.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Another cold ride this morning

🚲 📷

Wild Orchids.

The meadow where we walk the dog is covered with these rare orchids.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷🌱
Starting a new brew. This time I’m making “Stars & Stripes”, an American Pale Ale from The Greater Good. Should be drinking in about 2 weeks. 🍺

Sunset from last night

I was presented with this sunset around 8:45pm yesterday when I took the dog out for his "evening constitutional." The colours were amazing and the iPhone did a reasonable job at rendering them, with a little help from Lightroom.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app camera, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

We drove to the Cotswold Water Park yesterday for a bit of R and R. It was bright, but there was a cold wind if you weren't in a sheltered spot. Didn't stop a few hardy souls from venturing out on (and in) the water, though.

Sony a6300, Sony E 16-70 F4 ZA OSS, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

We've got new neighbours.

These ladies arrived in the field at the bottom of the garden today. Parker wasn't too impressed.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷 🐕

It's times like this that I wish I'd stumped up the additional cash for the iPhone 11 Pro to get the longer lens. I spotted these two in the field opposite our house whilst walking the dog this morning.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷
The pear tree in the field opposite is full of blossom. We’ll be picking pounds and pounds of fruit in the autumn. 📷

I love the early morning light.

I took this whilst out walking the dog about 7am today. The light coming between the trees made this shot.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

It was good to get out on Ruby tonight. Does anyone else name their bike?

📷🚲

Day trip to the coast.

It was great to escape and get away from staying at home for the first time in months. We packed a picnic, jumped in the car and drove to Lymington in Hampshire for some sunshine and sea air — great combination! 📷
The inevitable photo of a beer drinker’s first post-lockdown pint in a pub since Christmas Day. 📷🍺

Summer Rose.

Another photo from last summer to remind us that it won't be long before we can feel the warmth on our skin again. 📷 🌱

A picture is worth 1000 words.

Spotted on a hoarding in Bristol. 📷

Early morning walk with the dog.

This is a quick iPhone snap from about 6:45 am today when I was out with the dog for a tramp around the fields. The light on the trees opposite where I took the photo was perfect. It's a shame the iPhone doesn't do it justice.

iPhone 11, Lightroom app, processed in Lightroom Classic 📷

Lunchtime!

I took this using my Sony a6300 and 16-70mm lens at 70mm. The camera was connected to my iPad via WiFi, and I used the Sony app to fire the shutter remotely. The short lens and the WiFi signal hampered the shot, which meant I had to position the camera further away from the feeder than was optimum. 📷

Early morning in the garden.

It's not as warm as it looks! 📷🌱

Black & White Fishing Gear.

I took this photo a few years ago when on holiday in Florida.

📷

Summer!

Here's an image to remind you of what summer looks like.

📷🌱

Snow on the fields.

It snowed briefly yesterday evening and was -2 degrees earlier when I took "the boy" for his morning tramp across the fields.

iPhone 11, edited in Lightroom.

📷

Rockefeller Centre, NY.

This is a photo taken in March 2019 from the viewing platform of the Rockefeller Tower, NY.

📷

Spotted on the Royal Mile, Edinburgh

📷
Black and White Wreck 📷

Which path to take?

View of Sutton Benger, Wiltshire. 📷
View from Barbury Castle, Wiltshire. 📷

Three Tulips.

Here's a photo of a group of tulips, processed in Lightroom to desaturate the background to make the flowers the heroes. 📷 🌱
An attempt at making a high-key photo in Lightroom. 📷 🌱

Spring lamb.

Photo taken in Lacock, Wiltshire, whilst on a photography course. 📷

Venice in B&W.

Here’s a classic photo of gondolas I took in Venice when we were last there. 📷

Ladies on a beach.

Sticking with the beach and B&W theme, here’s a photo I took in Murcia, Spain a couple of years ago. 📷

Dorset coastline March 2020.

Here's a pre-lockdown photo from March 2020 to remind us that there is something to look forward to at the end of the current restrictions. 📷

Another black & white image, edited in Lightroom

This was taken a few years ago and I've always liked the detail around the engine and gearbox. 📷

Been playing with black & white in Lightroom.

This was taken in pre-lockdown 2020 when we managed to grab a long weekend in Dorset. 📷

Photos from the Rockefeller Centre, NY viewing platform.

We visited New York in March 2019 and booked a trip up the Rockefeller Centre. Unfortunately, it was very cloudy and we were presented with a whiteout, so photographing the NY skyline was out of the question and meant that I had to concentrate on the details.

📷 ✈️
